title: The Government must stand up for law and order
text:
Almost a fifth of all murders in England and Wales are now committed by people on probation and there has been a 63 per cent increase in the number of homicides by ex-inmates. This is a horrific situation. The whole point of the probation system is to keep an eye on the released, both to help them integrate into the community and to keep the public safe. The system should be as watertight as prison itself, and yet bungled reforms have helped drive things into the ground.
